articles.summary: An anonymous employee from San Francisco-based tech company, who used "quiet quitting" to travel abroad and claim one week of paid time off for four months without his boss noticing. The employee, who is based in Europe, said they typically work between one to three hours a day, depending on the amount of meetings they have. They also fiddle their tasks when not working on something particularly urgent or pressing. The worker used a mouse jiggler to make it appear like they were online even if they were not. This tactic has led to mass firings at other companies, including Wells Fargo.

articles.summary: Compression socks are a type of specialized sock designed to improve circulation in your lower extremities, encouraging blood and fluid movement towards your heart. High-quality compression socks may help reduce symptoms of lymphedema and edema, and reduce vein-related clotting emergencies such as deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism. They also help prevent swelling and varicose veins during pregnancy and improve performance and postworkout recovery during and following exercise. articles.title: Inside Camilla's relationship with her interior designer sister
articles.description: As reported by the Telegraph, now that William has taken over the Duchy of Cornwall, Camilla's sister Annabel is reportedly being removed from the payroll.
articles.content: There is nothing like a sisters' bond - even if you're the Queen. And for Camilla, that has proven to be nothing but true with her sibling Annabel Elliot, 74, loyally standing by her side for decades.... [12772 symbols]
articles.summary: Queen Camilla and her sister Annabel Elliot, an interior designer and antiques dealer, have a strong bond, having stood by each other for decades. Annabel, who has served as King Charles's chief designer of his estates for over 20 years, is reportedly being removed from the payroll after Prince William took over the Duchy of Cornwall. She was employed by the King, then Prince of Wales, and his wife, Queen Camilla, after his 2005 marriage to her elder sister, Charles. Despite this, Annabel has reportedly been not paid for her services as of 2023 to 2024. The Telegraph reports that Annabel received anywhere between £19,625 and £82,272 for her work, and receiving an additional £7,160 to £90,285 each year for stock and furniture. The pair have been seen together more frequently since Annabel's key role in the Coronation as her sister's companion and a pillar of support for her widowed younger sibling.

articles.content: San Juan (AP) — Puerto Rico’s governor signed a law on Wednesday that prohibits discrimination against people wearing Afros, curls, locs, twists, braids and other hairstyles in the racially diverse U.... [2756 symbols]

entities.data: Creating a Respectful and Open World for Natural Hair

articles.summary: Puerto Rico's governor signed a law that prohibits discrimination against people wearing Afros, curls, locs, twists, braids, and other hairstyles in the racially diverse U.S. territory. The law was celebrated by those who had long sought explicit protection for work, housing, education and public services. While Puerto Rico’s laws and constitution protect against discrimination, a precedent was set in 2016 when a court ruled that an employer's no-dreadlock policy in Alabama did not violate Title VII. However, the law states that people identified as Black or Afro descendant in Puerto Rico still face derogatory treatment, deprivation of opportunities, marginalization, exclusion and all kinds of discrimination.

articles.title: Over half of UK adults confess to hiding snacks to avoid sharing, study finds
articles.description: Over half reckon theirs would be at 'risk' of disappearing if left in a communal area - the underwear drawer and inside a cereal box were popular hiding spots.
articles.content: Research has revealed that over half of adults resort to hiding snacks around their home to prevent them from being eaten by others they live with. A survey of 2,000 individuals found that 51% believe... [3471 symbols]
articles.summary: Research has revealed that over half of UK adults confess to hiding snacks around their homes to prevent them from being eaten by their co-habitants. The study, commissioned by Walkers snacks, found that 51% of respondents believe their snacks would be in'serious risk' of vanishing if left in a shared area. Popular hiding places include the underwear drawer, inside a cereal box, and in a coat pocket. However, three quarters of these adults have been caught out trying to keep their snacks hidden. The research also revealed that 65% of those who hide their snacks have had their secret spots discovered by their roommates. The findings also revealed a generational divide in snack-hiding behaviour, with millennials being the most likely to snoop around for others' hidden snacks (42%) and Gen Zers preferring avoiding the kitchen cupboard. Londoners are the least adept at keeping their snack spots secret, with 88% having been rumbled at some point. Meanwhile, those aged 65 and older are the most cautious about sharing their snacks.

entities.data: the Journal of Ecology and Evolution
Meal or mate: Exploring the evidence of sexual cannibalism among amphibians’

articles.summary: Ecologist Dr. John Gould from the University of Newcastle in Australia has captured the moment a female green and golden bell frog attempted to eat a male suitor. The incident occurred on Kooragang Island, north of Sydney, while Gould was studying one of the last remaining strongholds for the threatened frog. This incident is the first video record between adults of this species. The circumstances of the attempted cannibalism have led Gould to suggest that female frogs may have a choice in exploiting potential male suitors for breeding or food, and that the male's call may determine his fate.

articles.summary: Northwest Youth Corps' Urban Community Forest Program, a five-week summer program that teaches young people about careers in urban forestry, has seen hundreds of youth transformed into successful careers. The program, which allows youth ages 15 to 18 to join for free, provides a stipend of up to $2,500 depending on their attendance and can receive high school credit. Students spend about 32 hours each week working for local agencies, including the City of Springfield Public Works Department, the City Eugene Parks and Open Space, Willamalane Parks and Recreation District, Oregon Dept of Forestry, Friends of Trees and Lane Education Service District. The students also learn about removing trees in urban forests and caring for urban areas in urban areas. The $12 million grant from the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Forest Service Urban and Community Forestry Inflation Reduction Act will fund the program for the next five years.

articles.summary: Psychologists have found that even those who lost loved ones, livelihood, or health, are still dealing with a diffuse, vague sense of wrongness four years after the deadly COVID-19 outbreak. This distress, which manifests in heightened loneliness, sapped social capacity, and withering bonds with community, is part of the emotional legacy of lockdown. A survey by the 2022 showed that one third of Americans found stress overwhelming daily, and nearly half reported they were more anxious in 2024 than they were the previous year. Health geographer Jessica Finlay has been tracking all 50 states since 2020 to track the ways they’ve coped with the crisis. She also found the highest levels of loneliness and isolation in respondents ages 15 to 20, but people of all ages complain of diminished social battery and increased apprehension. Despite these changes, experts believe that the trauma of the lockdown era has led to increased public conflict and increased public tension.

The Wall Street Journal named the best airport in the country in 2023, and it also ranked highly for on-time performance and customer experience in a study released in 2024. The airport changed hands several times before being purchased by the city of Phoenix for $100,000 in 1935. This acquisition ensured the continued operation and development of Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport.

articles.summary: Amino acid supplements, or supplements, are the building blocks of protein, which are found in all types of foods and are often found in the gym bags of athletes and bodybuilders. Each type of amino acid supplement contains a different combination of the nine essential aminos - phenylalanine, valine, tryptophan, threonine, isoleucine, methionine, histidine, leucine and and lysine - which all perform different functions in the body. These supplements can significantly increase muscle health and energy supply, particularly for those who exercise intensively and work hard to build and repair muscle. They are also beneficial for the health of their muscles, as well as their ability to absorb protein quickly compared to protein-rich food that can take three to four hours, which in supplement form takes only 30 minutes. Other benefits include supporting hair growth and health, regulating gut microbiome, immunity, and intestinal growth, and aiding in the development of healthy hair.

According to an online survey conducted by Rizz, 71% of people aged 18 and 27 are curious about the dating and romantic lives of Olympians. Experts suggest that the interest may reveal a deeper understanding of our society's relationship with sex in general. The visibility of the Olympics and its location in Paris have also contributed to this discussion. Sex therapist Erik Anderson suggests that a society is largely sex negative and that we often don't discuss sex as a great source of wellbeing, pleasure and peak life experiences. Social psychologist Sara Nasserzadeh argues that the Olympics offer an opportunity to broaden public discourse about sex and the dangers it poses.

entities.data: Frontiers in Cancer Control and Society

articles.summary: Pesticide exposure may raise the risk of certain forms of cancer, including leukemia, non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, and bladder, colon, lung, and pancreatic cancers, according to a study published in the journal Frontiers in Cancer Control and Society. The study compared 96 pesticides to cancer rates in thousands of counties across the country. The findings suggest that the high-risk pesticides and spraying methods are not only affecting those directly in the industry. The Environmental Protection Agency recommends that pesticides are present in produce and in the environment in the U.S. However, there are several strategies to reduce your exposure, including washing fruits and vegetables, peeling and trimming produce to remove pesticide residue. Experts also suggest that eating organic may help reduce exposure, but it may be too expensive for many people.

articles.summary: Gerry Barrett, owner of the 1,000-pound, concrete and rebar statue of Ursula Pickle, has moved her hippo to a quieter spot on North Carolina sand. The hippo was born out of a desire to honor his father and was transported to Chapel Hill in 1981 by Barrett and commissioned by Robert Gaston. The statue was set in Mill Race Branch near Bolin Creek, near the Chapel Hill Police Department, but was nearly destroyed in 1995 when developer Rolf Sass bought the land to build homes and the town discussed moving her to Umstead Park. The Great Hippo Hunt of '95 resulted in rumors of her being returned to the hippo, which led to a $200 reward for its return. Local Realtor Eunice Brock offered a $500 reward for Ursula's return, and local mural artist Michael Brown tried to negotiate the deal, but a year later, the money was still there. Barrett turned down the deal. The peace sculpture was never moved back to the town, despite being disassembled and disassembled from parts disassembled.

Board-certified dermatologist Karan Lal, MD, at Affiliated Dermatology in Scottsdale, America, explains that phermoones are a form of biological, nonverbal communication that can help humans attract mates and ward off prey in certain species. The article also discusses the cost of the perfume, which costs under £20 per person, and how it is often more expensive than the cost it would otherwise be.

articles.title: I asked six S.F. restaurants to justify their service fees. Most didn’t want to talk

articles.summary: California restaurants will soon be required to clearly indicate their service charges, which can range from 30% to 5% of their checks, starting in 2025. However, there is currently little regulation regarding the presentation of these fees. I asked six San Francisco restaurants to explain their fees, chosen for their high fees, distinctive phrasing, or both, to clarify their costs. The top of the list was Black Cat, a jazz bar and lounge in the Tenderloin, which added a 20% service charge and a 10% "SF safety and benefit charge" to the bill. The service charge is not a tip, but the cost of doing business is considered a significant component of the overall cost of business in the city. The author also highlighted the importance of the safety charge for patrons and staff, which has been associated with employee health care since 2008 when San Francisco law required businesses to set aside money for employees' health care. The article also mentions the high cost of employee benefits like paid sick leave and parental leave, which have become associated with these fees under the umbrella of "mandates". The author concludes that while many restaurants in San Francisco are particularly high, these fees seem exceptional due to high labor costs.

Recent additions include the steel tower and the Cloud Center.

articles.title: Try this light, delightfully bitter red wine from a promising new Bay Area winery
articles.description: Winemaker Terah Bajjalieh is making delicious, Italian-style wines in the Bay Area, and she defies definition.
articles.content: It’s not every day that a California Barbera catches my attention. But the Barbera that I recently tasted from Terah Wine Co. really turned my head: It’s vibrant, delightfully bitter and oozing with a... [3934 symbols]
articles.summary: Winemaker Terah Bajjalieh, a Palestinian American woman who started Terah Wine Co. in 2020, has been a standout winemaker in the Bay Area. The red wine from her new venture, Terah Barbera, is described as vibrant, delightfully bitter and fresh. The Barbera comes from Shake Ridge Ranch, a vineyard in Amador County, California. In addition to Shake Ridge, Bajalieher has purchased fruit from several acclaimed California winemakers. She also incorporates her own low-alcohol drink, Agua Fresca, which she calls an electric fuchsia in color. Despite her struggles in promoting her winery as an LGBT-run business, she remains committed to making great wine.

articles.title: Michelin-starred team opens S.F.’s newest wine bar
articles.description: The Michelin-starred Saison restaurant's new wine bar serves caviar and $75 glasses of Champagne.
articles.content: Saison Cellar & Wine Bar (234 Townsend St.) gives wine lovers the chance to sample pricey, world-renowned wines that are rarely poured by the glass — like Krug Champagne ($75) and grand cru Burgundy —... [4034 symbols]
articles.summary: Saison Cellar & Wine Bar in San Francisco has opened its doors to a 1,000-square-foot wine bar. The bar, which features world-renowned wines that are rarely poured by the glass, is designed to explore wine in a new way. Food pairings include truffle fries, a replica of chef Michael Mina's caviar parfait, and provisions from French bakery Maison Nico. This is the second Saison Wine Bar opened by co-founder Mark Bright, who also opened a Scotts Valley location last year near his Santa Cruz home. The restaurant's food menu includes caviar service ($98-$165), and a selection of Santa Cruz Mountains producers. The wine bar also features Madeira, the fortified wine produced on the Portuguese island of the same name.

articles.title: Sharaan Nature Reserve: World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.description: Find out why Sharaan Nature Reserve is one of the World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.content: Deep in the desert of AlUla, a one hour and forty-five -minute flight northwest of Riyadh, unselfconscious whooping echoes around the red-rock canyons of Sharaan Nature Reserve. Local tour operator Pa... [1609 symbols]

keywords.name: Local tour operator Pangea Adventures Club

articles.summary: Sharaan Nature Reserve, a desert resort in the desert of AlUla, is a one hour and forty-five-minute flight northwest of Riyadh from Riyadh. The reserve, now fenced, is home to wildlife species such as Idmi gazelle, red-necked ostrich, large-eared red fox, and the endangered Arabian leopard. Local tour operator Pangea Adventures Club operates off-road vehicles that race through the canyons on these expeditions. The Reserve is also home to 3,000-year-old rock carvings and thousands of petroglyphs, with guides describing their descent from bedouin who camped and were buried in this land. The World's Greatest Places issue has featured this week's featured travelogue.

articles.title: Bowie House, Auberge Resorts Collection: World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.description: Find out why Bowie House, Auberge Resorts Collection is one of the World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.content: Saddle up: there’s a new shelter in town. The luxury boutique hotel Bowie House, one of the latest additions to the Auberge Resorts Collection, pays homage to its local roots with Texas-sized charm. B... [1504 symbols]
articles.summary: The luxury boutique hotel Bowie House, one of the latest additions to the Auberge Resorts Collection, has been named World's Greatest Places 2024. The hotel, which pays homage to Fort Worth's roots with Texas-sized charm, features a wide range of guest rooms, including a unique Goodnight Suite with a fireplace. The spa Ash offers custom treatments including the Deep West, guided stretching, acupressure, and cupping. Recent experiences include trail rides, step-and-line dancing, and personalizing your own Texas rag with chain-stitch embroiderer Fowl & Maker. The city of Fort Worth is rapidly growing, with numerous hotels and restaurants in development and the upcoming debut of a James Turrell art installation and the National Juneteenth Museum in 2026.

articles.title: 'Heartbreaking': Bay Area family restaurant to shutter after nearly 40 years
articles.description: Newark's Nijo Castle opened in 1985 as a lively restaurant featuring big portions and entertainment for families.
articles.content: Throughout the 1990s and early aughts, my family of six piled into our Chevy Suburban to take the short 10-minute drive to Nijo Castle. Sometimes we’d go for birthday celebrations, as a reward for goo... [4955 symbols]
articles.summary: Nijo Castle, a Bay Area family restaurant that served food for nearly 40 years, is set to close its doors on July 31 after nearly four decades of service. The closure comes as plans for the Newark Planning Commission to demolish the site and build a five-story AC Hotel by Marriott in its place. The hotel will join the existing Hyatt and Hilton hotels in the adjacent area. A Facebook group Fremont & Niles California Memories shared a post announcing the closure, which has been shared hundreds of times by loyal customers who shared memories of dining at Nijo Cast. Despite multiple attempts to connect with the owners and thank them for their memories, the closure has not been disclosed.

articles.description: Find out why Anantara Convento di Amalfi Grand Hotel is one of the World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.content:
The coastal view at Anantara Convento di Amalfi Grand Hotel Credit - Courtesy of Anantara Hotels & Resorts

The newly renovated Anantara Convento di Amalfi doesn’t merely reflect the local history—it’... [1971 symbols]

keywords.name: Anantara Convento di Amalfi Grand Hotel

entities.data: Anantara Convento di Amalfi Grand Hotel

articles.summary: The newly renovated Anantara Convento di Amalfi Grand Hotel is set in a 13th-century Capuchin convent and features a 52-room boutique hotel set 262 feet above the sea. The hotel was restored using the original cloisters and frescoes dating back to 1223, and a Baroque church. The property's rooms and suites echo the contemplative ambiance of the former monk’s quarters, with lime-washed walls, vaulted ceilings, and terracotta tiling. Unique experiences include tours of the convent and garden with Franciscan Friar Marcus. The entire property has been designed to maximize views and is a gateway to the rest of the stunning region.

articles.title: Le Grand Mazarin: World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.description: Find out why Le Grand Mazarin is one of the World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.content: With hundreds of hotels in Paris, Le Grand Mazarin still manages to stand out for its luxury and aesthetic. While you might miss the discreet entrance in Le Marais, inside guests are instantly transpo... [1215 symbols]
articles.summary: Le Grand Mazarin, a luxury hotel in Paris, has been nominated for the World's Greatest Places 2024 list. The hotel features architect and designer Martin Brudnizki's elaborate reception and seafoam green pleated silk ceiling, and tasseled wall sconces. The restaurant, Boubalé, serves dishes inspired by Eastern European Jewish cuisine. The 61 uniquely shaped rooms and suites upstairs feature patterned wallpapers, furnishings, and textiles. The basement-level wellness area includes a pool and whirlpool featuring intricate mosaics and a vaulted ceiling painted by Parisian artist Jacques Merle.

articles.title: Communal Kutaisi: World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.description: Find out why Communal Kutaisi is one of the World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.content: Looking beyond Tbilisi and the Kakheti wine region for a fourth addition to its clutch of boutique hotels, The Communal Company turned to the small city of Kutaisi (population: 180,000), the unofficia... [1123 symbols]

keywords.name: the historic Galaktion Tabidze Street residence

articles.summary: The The Communal Company has chosen Kutaisi, Georgia, as its fourth addition to its boutique hotels. The interior designer, Katya Samsonadze, has incorporated contemporary nostalgia into the design, evoking the city's artistic past. The onsite restaurant, Doli, evokes the intimacy of a writers’ salon with restored ceramic fireplace and charcoal ceilings. Each of the 10 rooms has an unusual floorplan that accommodates the original contours of a former private house. Breakfast is served family-style to encourage dialogue and an atmosphere of collaboration.

articles.title: Melesin Distillery: World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.description: Find out why Melesin Distillery is one of the World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.content: There was a time when ruby-red Mavrud wines were so coveted, bottles were earmarked exclusively for Albania’s party elite. After the fall of communism in 1990, wine-producing towns such as Leskovik—lo... [1316 symbols]
articles.summary: Melesin Distillery, a hotel, restaurant, and distillery in one, is set to be named one of the World's Greatest Places 2024. Named for the limestone massif that towers over its lone minaret, the distillery is located 180 miles from the capital of Tirana and aims to set the bar for “Made in Albania” spirits and put this overlooked region back on the map. The Italian-made copper stills are used to refine raki and gin from local grapes and juniper berries in an effort to showcase the region's "Made in Alban" spirits. The distillery has also introduced new raki/gin degustations and is introducing new wine and gin degastations this year.

articles.title: De Durgerdam: World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.description: Find out why De Durgerdam is one of the World's Greatest Places 2024
articles.content: When Amsterdam locals and tourists want to escape to the countryside, all they have to do is cross IJsselmeer Lake; the Landelijk Noord region is a 15 minute drive from Central Station, and also acces... [1432 symbols]
articles.summary: Dutch hospitality group Aedes has opened De Durgerdam, a 14-room lakefront boutique hotel in the Landelijk Noord region. The hotel partly inhabits a restored 17th-century former fishermen’s inn, inspired by the fishing past. Local design studio Buro Belén has included details such as a net-like chandelier, a wall-hanging made from shredded ropes, and tiny metal fish on the wall of lobby restaurant and bar, De Mark. The original building features wooden beams, cozy window seats, velvet throws, and bathrooms clad in bespoke tiles from the Netherlands' oldest ceramics company.
